name: Crock Pot Roast
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Place beef roast in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
stepsFR: Placer le roti dans la cocotte en fonte
Melanger les sachets de sauces en poudre dans un bol et saupoudrer le roti avec.
Arroser le roti

name: Roasted Asparagus
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Cut off the woody bottom part of the asparagus spears and discard.
With a vegetable peeler, peel off the skin on the bottom 2-3 inches of the spears (this keeps the asparagus from being all.",string.", and if you eat asparagus you know what I mean by that).
Place asparagus on foil-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt.
With your hands, roll the asparagus around until they are evenly coated with oil and salt.
Roast for 10-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your stalks and how tender you like them.
They should be tender when pierced with the tip of a knife.
The tips of the spears will get very brown but watch them to prevent burning.
They are great plain, but sometimes I serve them with a light vinaigrette if we need something acidic to balance out our meal.
stepsFR: Prechauffer le four a 425°F.
Enlever le bois

name: Curried Lentils and Rice
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Bring broth to a low boil.
Add curry powder and salt.
Cook lentils for 20 minutes.
Add rice and simmer for 20 minutes.
Enjoy!

name: Big Night Pizza
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Add hot water to yeast in a large bowl and let sit for 15 minutes.
Mix in oil, sugar, salt, and flour and let sit for 1 hour.
Knead the dough and spread onto a pan.
Spread pizza sauce and sprinkle cheese.
Add any optional toppings as you wish.
Bake at 400 deg Fahrenheit for 15 minutes.
Enjoy!

name: Cranberry and Apple Stuffed Acorn Squash Recipe
nameFR: Courge poivrée farcies aux cranberries et aux pommes
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Cut squash in half, remove seeds.
Place squash in baking dish, cut-side down.
Pour 1/4-inch water into dish.
Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F.
In large bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
Remove squash from oven, fill with mix.
Bake for 30-40 more minutes, until squash tender.
Enjoy!

name: Mic's Yorkshire Puds
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Put the flour and some seasoning into a large bowl.
Stir in eggs, one at a time.
Whisk in milk until you have a smooth batter.
Chill in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oven to 220C/gas mark 7.
Pour the oil into the holes of a 8-hole muffin tin.
Heat tin in the oven for 5 minutes.
Ladle the batter mix into the tin.
Bake for 30 minutes until well browned and risen.

name: Old-Fashioned Oatmeal Cookies
Author: F.Vernier
steps: Simmer raisins and water over medium heat until raisins are plump, about 15 minutes.
Drain raisins, reserving the liquid.
Add enough water to reserved liquid to measure 1/2 cup.
Heat oven to 400°.
Mix thoroughly shortening, sugar, eggs and vanilla.
Stir in reserved liquid.
Blend in remaining ingredients.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown.
About 6 1/2 dozen cookies.

name: Blueberry Oatmeal Squares
steps: Filling: In saucepan, bring blueberries, sugar and orange juice to boil; reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes.
Whisk cornstarch with 2 tbsp (25 mL) water; whisk into blueberries and boil, stirring, until thickened, about 1 minute.
Place plastic wrap directly on surface; refrigerate until cooled, about 1 hour.
In large bowl, whisk together oats, flour, sugar, orange rind and salt ; with pastry blender, cut in butter until in coarse crumbs.
Press half into 8-inch (2 L) square parchment paper–lined metal cake pan; spread with blueberry filling.
Bake in centre of 350°F oven until light golden, about 45 minutes.
Let cool on rack before cutting into squares.
(Make-ahead: Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days or overwrap with heavy-duty foil and freeze for up to 2 weeks.)

name: Pelmeni
Author: chef
steps: Cuisiner
Manger
stepsFR: Cook and cool
Manger

name: Borscht
Author: chef

ingredientsFR.name: pommes de terre, pelées et en dés

steps: In a large pot, sauté onions and carrots until softened.
Add broth, potatoes, and cabbage. Bring to a boil, then simmer until potatoes are tender.
Add grated beets, tomato paste, and vinegar. Simmer for another 10-15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream and fresh dill.
stepsFR: Dans une grande marmite, faire revenir les oignons et les carottes jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient tendres.
Ajouter le bouillon, les pommes de terre et le chou. Porter à ébullition, puis laisser mijoter jusqu'à ce que les pommes de terre soient tendres.
Ajouter les betteraves râpées, le concentré de tomate et le vinaigre. Laisser mijoter encore 10-15 minutes.
Assaisonner avec sel et poivre au goût.
Servir chaud, garni d'une cuillerée de crème aigre et d'aneth frais.

name: Blini (Russian Pancakes)
Author: admin
steps: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm milk. Let stand for 10 minutes until foamy.
In a bowl, whisk together flour and salt.
Add the yeast mixture, egg, and melted butter to the flour. Whisk until smooth.
Cover the bowl and let the batter rise in a warm place for about 1 hour.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each blin.
Cook for about 2 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Serve warm with desired toppings (sour cream, caviar, smoked salmon, jam).
stepsFR: Dissoudre la levure et le sucre dans le lait tiède. Laisser reposer 10 minutes jusqu'à ce que ça mousse.
Dans un bol, mélanger la farine et le sel.
Ajouter le mélange de levure, l'oeuf et le beurre fondu à la farine. Mélanger jusqu'à consistance lisse.
Couvrir le bol et laisser la pâte lever dans un endroit chaud pendant environ 1 heure.
Chauffer une plaque ou une poêle légèrement huilée à feu moyen.
Verser ou déposer la pâte sur la plaque, en utilisant environ 1/4 tasse par blin.
Cuire environ 2 minutes de chaque côté, ou jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient dorés. Servir chaud avec les garnitures désirées (crème aigre, caviar, saumon fumé, confiture).

name: Beef Stroganoff
steps: Season beef strips with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, melt half the butter over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches; remove and set aside.
Melt remaining butter in the skillet. Add onions and mushrooms, cook until softened and browned.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in beef broth until smooth. Bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard. Do not boil.
Return beef to the skillet and heat through.
Serve immediately over cooked egg noodles or rice.
stepsFR: Assaisonner les lanières de boeuf avec sel et poivre.
Dans une grande poêle, faire fondre la moitié du beurre à feu moyen-vif. Faire dorer le boeuf en plusieurs fois; retirer et réserver.
Faire fondre le reste du beurre dans la poêle. Ajouter les oignons et les champignons, cuire jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient tendres et dorés.
Ajouter l'ail et cuire 1 minute de plus.
Saupoudrer la farine sur les légumes et cuire en remuant pendant 1 minute.
Incorporer graduellement le bouillon de boeuf au fouet jusqu'à consistance lisse. Porter à frémissement en grattant les sucs.
Réduire le feu à doux. Incorporer la crème aigre et la moutarde de Dijon. Ne pas faire bouillir.
Remettre le boeuf dans la poêle et réchauffer.
Servir immédiatement sur des nouilles aux oeufs cuites ou du riz.

name: Olivier Salad (Salat Olivye)
Author: chef
steps: Ensure all boiled ingredients (potatoes, carrots, eggs) are completely cooled.
In a large bowl, combine diced potatoes, carrots, eggs, pickles, peas, and chicken/ham.
Add chopped onion, if using.
Gently fold in the mayonnaise until all ingredients are coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Chill the salad in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Shashlik (Russian Skewers)
Author: admin

ingredients.name: lamb shoulder or pork loin, cut into 1.5-inch cubes
onions, cut into thick rings or wedges

steps: In a large non-reactive bowl, combine meat cubes and onion rings.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together vinegar, oil, coriander, pepper, salt, and bay leaves (if using).
Pour the marinade over the meat and onions. Toss well to coat.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, tossing occasionally.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated meat and onion pieces onto metal or soaked wooden skewers.
Grill the skewers for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot.

name: Syrniki (Cheese Pancakes)
Author: chef

ingredients.name: all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

steps: In a bowl, combine tvorog, egg, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. Mix well.
Gradually add flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. It might be slightly sticky.
Dust your hands and a work surface with flour.
Take spoonfuls of the dough, roll into balls, then flatten into small, thick pancakes (about 1/2 inch thick).
Heat oil or butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Carefully place syrniki in the hot pan (do not overcrowd).
Fry for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve warm with sour cream, jam, honey, or fresh berries.

name: Okroshka (Cold Soup)
steps: Ensure potatoes and eggs are cooked and cooled completely.
In a large bowl or pot, combine diced potatoes, eggs, cucumbers, radishes, green onions, dill, and cooked meat (if using).
Gently mix the solid ingredients.
Just before serving, pour cold kvass or kefir over the ingredients.
Stir well and season with salt to taste.
Ladle into bowls and serve immediately. Offer sour cream and mustard on the side if desired.

name: Pirozhki (Stuffed Buns)
Author: admin

ingredients.name: basic yeast dough recipe (flour, yeast, water/milk, sugar, salt, oil/butter)
cooked cabbage, seasoned ground meat, mashed potatoes, mushrooms, etc.

steps: Prepare your preferred yeast dough and let it rise.
Prepare your chosen filling and let it cool.
Punch down the risen dough and divide into small, equal portions.
Roll out each portion into a small circle.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each circle.
Fold the dough over the filling, pinching the edges firmly to seal, forming an oval or round bun.
Place pirozhki seam-side down on a baking sheet (for baking) or prepare for frying.
If baking, let rise again for 20-30 minutes, brush with egg wash, and bake at 375°F (190°C) until golden brown (15-20 min).
If frying, heat oil in a pan and fry pirozhki until golden brown on both sides.

name: Solyanka (Meat Soup)
Author: chef

ingredients.name: mixed cooked meats (ham, sausage, beef), chopped

steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt butter/oil over medium heat. Sauté onions until translucent.
Add the chopped mixed meats and cook for a few minutes.
Stir in the chopped pickles, capers, olives, and tomato paste. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in the broth and bring the soup to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer gently for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Season with salt and pepper if necessary (be mindful of salty ingredients).
Serve hot, garnished with lemon slices, a dollop of sour cream, and fresh dill.

name: Kulebyaka (Salmon Pie)

ingredients.name: puff pastry or rich yeast dough

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Season salmon fillet with salt and pepper.
Roll out the pastry dough into a large rectangle on a lightly floured surface.
Place half of the cooked rice/buckwheat mixture down the center third of the dough.
Layer sliced eggs over the rice.
Place the salmon fillet on top of the eggs.
Mix sautéed mushrooms, onions, and dill. Spread this mixture over the salmon.
Top with the remaining rice/buckwheat.
Fold the sides of the dough over the filling, overlapping slightly. Trim excess dough. Pinch ends to seal.
Carefully transfer the pie to a baking sheet, seam-side down. Cut a few slits in the top for steam to escape.
Brush the entire surface with the beaten egg wash.
Bake for 25-35 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and puffed, and the salmon is cooked through.
Let rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
